INPUT_QUERY: Generate a report for the holiday gift guide
EXPECTED_TOOLS:
{
  "ground_truth_invocations": [
    {
      "tool_name": "query_performance_metrics",
      "tool_output": {
        "SQL": "WITH __campaigns AS (
  SELECT
    campaign_id,
    campaign_name,
    campaign_type,
    channel,
    end_date,
    start_date,
    status
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGNS
)
SELECT
  c.campaign_id,
  c.campaign_name,
  c.start_date,
  c.end_date,
  c.status,
  c.channel,
  c.campaign_type
FROM __campaigns AS c
WHERE
  LOWER(c.campaign_name) LIKE '%holiday%gift%guide%'
  OR LOWER(c.campaign_name) LIKE '%gift%guide%holiday%'
ORDER BY
  c.start_date DESC NULLS LAST
 -- Generated by Cortex Analyst
;"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 1
    },
    {
      "tool_name": "generate_campaign_report",
      "tool_output": {
        "CUSTOM_TOOL_RESULT": "Report CAMPAIGN_8_2025-12-11_22_33.html generated and uploaded to stage. View here - https://app.snowflake.com/SFSENORTHAMERICA/DEMO_EBOTWICK/#/data/databases/MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB/schemas/PUBLIC/stage/CAMPAIGN_REPORTS"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 2
    },
    {
      "tool_name": "query_performance_metrics",
      "tool_output": {
        "SQL": "WITH __performance AS (
  SELECT
    date,
    campaign_id,
    roi_percentage,
    revenue_generated,
    impressions,
    conversions,
    clicks
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE
), __campaigns AS (
  SELECT
    campaign_id,
    campaign_name
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGNS
), campaign_performance AS (
  SELECT
    p.date,
    p.campaign_id,
    p.revenue_generated,
    p.roi_percentage,
    p.conversions,
    p.impressions,
    p.clicks
  FROM __performance AS p
  LEFT OUTER JOIN __campaigns AS c
    ON p.campaign_id = c.campaign_id
  WHERE
    p.date <= CURRENT_DATE
    AND (
      c.campaign_id = '8' OR LOWER(c.campaign_name) LIKE '%holiday%gift%guide%2024%'
    )
)
SELECT
  cp.campaign_id,
  MIN(cp.date) AS start_date,
  MAX(cp.date) AS end_date,
  COUNT(cp.date) AS days_with_data,
  SUM(cp.revenue_generated) AS total_revenue,
  AVG(cp.roi_percentage) AS avg_roi,
  SUM(cp.conversions) AS total_conversions,
  SUM(cp.impressions) AS total_impressions,
  SUM(cp.clicks) AS total_clicks,
  MIN(cp.revenue_generated) AS min_daily_revenue,
  MAX(cp.revenue_generated) AS max_daily_revenue
FROM campaign_performance AS cp
GROUP BY
  cp.campaign_id
ORDER BY
  cp.campaign_id
 -- Generated by Cortex Analyst
;"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 3
    }
  ],
  "ground_truth_output": "## Holiday Gift Guide 2024 Campaign Report Generated I've successfully generated a comprehensive HTML report for the Holiday Gift Guide 2024 campaign. The report has been created and uploaded to your Snowflake stage. **Access the full report here:** [CAMPAIGN_8_2025-12-11_22_33.html](https://app.snowflake.com/SFSENORTHAMERICA/DEMO_EBOTWICK/#/data/databases/MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB/schemas/PUBLIC/stage/CAMPAIGN_REPORTS) ## Key Performance Insights Based on the campaign data, here are the standout performance metrics for the Holiday Gift Guide 2024 campaign: ### Campaign Overview - **Campaign ID:** 8 - **Campaign Period:** November 1 - December 24, 2024 (54 days) - **Channel:** Display advertising - **Status:** Active ### Performance Highlights - **Total Revenue:** $1,251,542 - **Average ROI:** 142.46% (exceptionally strong performance) - **Total Conversions:** 9,648 - **Total Impressions:** 6,682,532 - **Total Clicks:** 211,477 - **Click-through Rate:** 3.16% (211,477 clicks ÷ 6,682,532 impressions) - **Conversion Rate:** 4.56% (9,648 conversions ÷ 211,477 clicks) ### Daily Performance Range - **Minimum Daily Revenue:** $7,512 - **Maximum Daily Revenue:** $44,473 - **Average Daily Revenue:** $23,177 This campaign demonstrates excellent performance with a strong ROI of over 140% and solid conversion metrics throughout the holiday season. The comprehensive HTML report contains detailed breakdowns, visualizations, and additional insights for deeper analysis."
}

INPUT_QUERY: What are key themes and financial metrics for the black friday campaign

{
  "ground_truth_invocations": [

    roi_percentage,
    revenue_generated,
    cost_per_click,
    impressions,
    conversions,
    clicks,
    cost_per_acquisition
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE
), __campaigns AS (
  SELECT
    campaign_id,
    campaign_name
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGNS
), black_friday_performance AS (
  SELECT
    p.date,
    p.campaign_id,
    c.campaign_name,
    p.revenue_generated,
    p.roi_percentage,
    p.conversions,
    p.cost_per_click,
    p.cost_per_acquisition,
    p.clicks,
    p.impressions

    LOWER(c.campaign_name) LIKE '%black friday%' AND p.date <= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP()

      },

  "ground_truth_output": "## Black Friday Campaign Analysis ### Financial Metrics The Black Friday Mega Sale campaign ran from **November 15-30, 2024** and delivered strong performance: **Revenue & ROI:** - Total Revenue: **$394,118** - Average ROI: **161.25%** - Daily revenue range: $10,779 - $41,258 **Conversion Performance:** - Total Conversions: **2,228** - Average Cost per Acquisition: **$62.13** - Total Clicks: **49,307** - Total Impressions: **1,648,872** - Average Cost per Click: **$2.45** ### Key Themes & Strategy **Campaign Approach:** - **Multi-channel promotional push** across all channels with emphasis on social media - **Doorbusters and flash sales** to create urgency - **Exclusive early access for email subscribers** to reward loyalty **Messaging Strategy:** - Urgency-focused copy: "BLACK FRIDAY IS HERE! Doorbuster deals starting at midnight" - VIP treatment: "Early VIP access for email subscribers" - Value proposition: "Shop the biggest deals of the year!" **Key Performance Insights:** - **Mobile-first approach:** 75% of traffic came from mobile devices - **Push notifications highly effective:** 89% open rate - **Early access strategy successful:** Email subscribers generated 45% of day-one revenue **Customer Feedback & Areas for Improvement:** - Customer satisfaction: **4.60/5.0** - Positive feedback on deals and helpful push notifications - **Challenge identified:** Website performance issues during peak hours - **Recommended improvements:** Better site performance and clearer deal expiration times The Black Friday campaign successfully combined aggressive promotional pricing with a mobile-optimized, multi-channel approach that prioritized early access for loyal customers, resulting in strong ROI and conversion performance."
}

INPUT_QUERY: Which two campaigns are most alike
What was the customer feedback on our mobile app campaign?
Are there any temporal trends around revenue
EXPECTED_TOOLS:
{
  "ground_truth_invocations": [
    {
      "tool_name": "query_performance_metrics",
      "tool_output": {
        "SQL": "WITH __performance AS (
  SELECT
    date,
    revenue_generated
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE
), daily_revenue AS (
  SELECT
    p.date,
    SUM(p.revenue_generated) AS daily_revenue
  FROM __performance AS p
  WHERE
    p.date <= CURRENT_DATE
  GROUP BY
    p.date
), monthly_revenue AS (
  SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', date) AS month,
    SUM(daily_revenue) AS monthly_revenue,
    COUNT(date) AS days_in_month,
    MIN(date) AS min_date,
    MAX(date) AS max_date
  FROM daily_revenue
  GROUP BY
    DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', date)
), yearly_revenue AS (
  SELECT
    DATE_PART('year', date) AS year,
    SUM(daily_revenue) AS yearly_revenue,
    COUNT(date) AS days_in_year,
    MIN(date) AS min_date,
    MAX(date) AS max_date
  FROM daily_revenue
  GROUP BY
    DATE_PART('year', date)
), weekly_revenue AS (
  SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('WEEK', date) AS week,
    SUM(daily_revenue) AS weekly_revenue,
    COUNT(date) AS days_in_week,
    MIN(date) AS min_date,
    MAX(date) AS max_date
  FROM daily_revenue
  GROUP BY
    DATE_TRUNC('WEEK', date)
), dow_revenue AS (
  SELECT
    DAYNAME(date) AS day_of_week,
    AVG(daily_revenue) AS avg_daily_revenue,
    COUNT(date) AS total_days,
    MIN(date) AS min_date,
    MAX(date) AS max_date
  FROM daily_revenue
  GROUP BY
    DAYNAME(date)
)
SELECT
  'Daily' AS time_period,
  CAST(date AS TEXT) AS period_label,
  daily_revenue AS revenue,
  1 AS period_count,
  date AS min_date,
  date AS max_date
FROM daily_revenue
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'Monthly' AS time_period,
  CAST(month AS TEXT) AS period_label,
  monthly_revenue AS revenue,
  days_in_month AS period_count,
  min_date,
  max_date
FROM monthly_revenue
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'Yearly' AS time_period,
  CAST(year AS TEXT) AS period_label,
  yearly_revenue AS revenue,
  days_in_year AS period_count,
  min_date,
  max_date
FROM yearly_revenue
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'Weekly' AS time_period,
  CAST(week AS TEXT) AS period_label,
  weekly_revenue AS revenue,
  days_in_week AS period_count,
  min_date,
  max_date
FROM weekly_revenue
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'Day of Week' AS time_period,
  day_of_week AS period_label,
  avg_daily_revenue AS revenue,
  total_days AS period_count,
  min_date,
  max_date
FROM dow_revenue
ORDER BY
  time_period,
  period_label DESC NULLS LAST
 -- Generated by Cortex Analyst
;"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 1
    }
  ],
  "ground_truth_output": "Yes, there are several clear temporal trends in revenue data for 2024: ## **Seasonal Revenue Patterns** **Peak Season (April-June):** Revenue reaches its highest levels during spring/early summer: - May: $5,290,868 (peak month) - June: $4,723,412 - April: $5,034,784 **Growth Phase (January-March):** Steady building momentum: - January: $385,145 (partial month, started Jan 15) - February: $1,873,608 - March: $3,508,212 **Summer Decline (July-September):** Gradual decrease from peak: - July: $3,860,068 - August: $3,389,237 - September: $3,153,349 **Fall/Winter Slowdown (October-December):** Lower revenue levels: - October: $3,054,219 - November: $2,696,945 - December: $2,164,759 ## **Weekly & Daily Patterns** **Day of Week Consistency:** Revenue is relatively stable across weekdays, averaging $106K-116K daily with Tuesday slightly higher ($115,686 average). **Weekly Trends:** Peak weekly performance occurred during the spring season, with several weeks in May generating over $1.2M. ## **Key Insights** 1. **Clear seasonality** with spring being the strongest revenue period 2. **Declining trend** from summer peak through year-end 3. **Strong business momentum** building from January through May 4. **Consistent daily patterns** without significant weekday variations The total annual revenue reached $39.13M across 352 days of data collection."
}

INPUT_QUERY: What's the relationship between campaign duration, budget size, and revenue across different audience segments
EXPECTED_TOOLS:
{
  "ground_truth_invocations": [
    {
      "tool_name": "query_performance_metrics",
      "tool_output": {
        "SQL": "WITH __campaigns AS (
  SELECT
    campaign_id,
    end_date,
    start_date,
    target_audience,
    budget_allocated
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGNS
), __performance AS (
  SELECT
    date,
    campaign_id,
    revenue_generated
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE
), campaign_metrics AS (
  SELECT
    c.target_audience,
    c.campaign_id,
    c.start_date,
    c.end_date,
    DATEDIFF(DAY, c.start_date, c.end_date) + 1 AS campaign_duration_days,
    c.budget_allocated,
    SUM(p.revenue_generated) AS total_revenue
  FROM __campaigns AS c
  LEFT OUTER JOIN __performance AS p
    ON c.campaign_id = p.campaign_id
  WHERE
    p.date <= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP()
  GROUP BY
    c.target_audience,
    c.campaign_id,
    c.start_date,
    c.end_date,
    c.budget_allocated
)
SELECT
  target_audience,
  COUNT(campaign_id) AS campaign_count,
  MIN(start_date) AS earliest_start_date,
  MAX(end_date) AS latest_end_date,
  AVG(campaign_duration_days) AS avg_campaign_duration_days,
  MIN(campaign_duration_days) AS min_campaign_duration_days,
  MAX(campaign_duration_days) AS max_campaign_duration_days,
  AVG(budget_allocated) AS avg_budget_allocated,
  MIN(budget_allocated) AS min_budget_allocated,
  MAX(budget_allocated) AS max_budget_allocated,
  SUM(total_revenue) AS total_revenue_by_segment,
  AVG(total_revenue) AS avg_revenue_per_campaign
FROM campaign_metrics
GROUP BY
  target_audience
ORDER BY
  total_revenue_by_segment DESC NULLS LAST
 -- Generated by Cortex Analyst
;"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 1
    }
  ],
  "ground_truth_output": "## Key Findings **Duration vs Revenue Relationship:** - **Longer campaigns (90-123 days) generate highest revenue**: Enterprise Decision Makers ($3.1M, 123 days), Tech Professionals ($3M, 121 days), and Eco-Conscious Consumers ($2.7M, 108 days) - **Medium campaigns (60-90 days)** show strong performance with segments like Existing Customers ($2.4M, 91 days) - **Short campaigns (3-31 days)** generally produce lower revenue, with exceptions like high-budget segments **Budget vs Revenue Efficiency:** - **High-budget segments** don't always yield proportional returns: - All Segments: $300K budget → $394K revenue (1.3x return) - Online Shoppers: $250K budget → $159K revenue (0.6x return) - **Moderate budgets show better efficiency**: - Enterprise Decision Makers: $85K budget → $3.1M revenue (36.6x return) - Existing Customers: $60K budget → $2.4M revenue (40.4x return) ## Segment Performance Patterns **Top Revenue Generators:** 1. **Enterprise Decision Makers** - Long duration (123 days) + moderate budget ($85K) = highest revenue ($3.1M) 2. **Tech Professionals 30-55** - Long duration (121 days) + high budget ($200K) = strong revenue ($3M) 3. **Eco-Conscious Consumers** - Long duration (108 days) + moderate budget ($90K) = solid revenue ($2.7M) **Efficiency Leaders:** - B2B segments (Enterprise, Professionals, Decision Makers) show exceptional budget efficiency - Existing customer segments deliver strong ROI with moderate investments - Short-term, high-budget campaigns often underperform **Strategic Insights:** - **Duration matters most**: Campaigns over 90 days consistently outperform shorter ones - **Budget efficiency varies dramatically** by audience type - **B2B segments** offer the best combination of high revenue and budget efficiency - **Consumer segments** require longer nurturing periods but deliver solid returns"
}

      },

  ],
  "ground_truth_output": "# Campaign #12 Performance Report I've successfully generated a comprehensive report for Campaign #12. The report has been created and is available at: https://app.snowflake.com/SFSENORTHAMERICA/DEMO_EBOTWICK/#/data/databases/MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB/schemas/PUBLIC/stage/CAMPAIGN_REPORTS ## Key Performance Insights **Campaign Overview:** - **Duration:** July 1-31, 2024 (31 days) - **Total Revenue Generated:** $699,767 - **Average ROI:** 177.45% **Engagement Metrics:** - **Total Impressions:** 4,140,034 - **Total Clicks:** 159,426 - **Total Conversions:** 7,237 - **Click-Through Rate:** 3.85% - **Conversion Rate:** 4.54% **Cost Efficiency:** - **Average Cost Per Click:** $2.10 - **Average Cost Per Acquisition:** $55.03 ## Performance Analysis **Strengths:** - **Exceptional ROI:** At 177.45%, this campaign delivered outstanding returns, significantly above industry benchmarks - **Strong Revenue Performance:** Generated nearly $700K in revenue over a single month - **Effective Conversion Rate:** 4.54% conversion rate indicates strong audience targeting and compelling messaging - **Consistent Daily Performance:** Data available for all 31 days shows consistent campaign execution **Key Success Factors:** - Cost-efficient customer acquisition at $55.03 per conversion - Strong engagement with over 4M impressions leading to meaningful conversions - Balanced cost structure with reasonable $2.10 cost per click This campaign represents a highly successful marketing effort with strong financial returns and efficient customer acquisition metrics."
}

INPUT_QUERY: What was the performance of the flash sale campaign?
EXPECTED_TOOLS:
{
  "ground_truth_invocations": [
    {
      "tool_name": "query_performance_metrics",
      "tool_output": {
        "SQL": "WITH __performance AS (
  SELECT
    date,
    campaign_id,
    roi_percentage,
    revenue_generated,
    engagement_rate,
    cost_per_click,
    impressions,
    conversions,
    clicks,
    cost_per_acquisition
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE
), __campaigns AS (
  SELECT
    campaign_id,
    campaign_name
  FROM MARKETING_CAMPAIGNS_DB.PUBLIC.CAMPAIGNS
), flash_sale_performance AS (
  SELECT
    p.date,
    p.campaign_id,
    c.campaign_name,
    p.revenue_generated,
    p.roi_percentage,
    p.conversions,
    p.clicks,
    p.impressions,
    p.engagement_rate,
    p.cost_per_click,
    p.cost_per_acquisition
  FROM __performance AS p
  LEFT OUTER JOIN __campaigns AS c
    ON p.campaign_id = c.campaign_id
  WHERE
    LOWER(c.campaign_name) LIKE '%flash sale%' AND p.date <= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP()
)
SELECT
  campaign_name,
  MIN(date) AS start_date,
  MAX(date) AS end_date,
  COUNT(date) AS total_days,
  SUM(revenue_generated) AS total_revenue,
  AVG(roi_percentage) AS avg_roi,
  SUM(conversions) AS total_conversions,
  SUM(clicks) AS total_clicks,
  SUM(impressions) AS total_impressions,
  AVG(engagement_rate) AS avg_engagement_rate,
  AVG(cost_per_click) AS avg_cost_per_click,
  AVG(cost_per_acquisition) AS avg_cost_per_acquisition,
  COUNT(DISTINCT campaign_id) AS campaign_count,
  AVG(revenue_generated) AS avg_daily_revenue
FROM flash_sale_performance
GROUP BY
  campaign_name
ORDER BY
  total_revenue DESC NULLS LAST
 -- Generated by Cortex Analyst
;"
      },
      "tool_sequence": 1
    }
  ],
  "ground_truth_output": "The Flash Sale - 48 Hours campaign showed strong performance across key metrics: ## Campaign Overview - **Duration**: May 20-22, 2024 (3 days) - **Total Revenue**: $99,182 - **Average Daily Revenue**: $33,061 ## Key Performance Metrics - **ROI**: 129% (excellent return on investment) - **Conversions**: 395 total - **Engagement Rate**: 4.73% - **Cost per Acquisition**: $61.00 - **Cost per Click**: $3.40 ## Traffic & Reach - **Total Clicks**: 22,248 - **Total Impressions**: 278,793 - **Click-through Rate**: ~8.0% (calculated from clicks/impressions) ## Performance Assessment The flash sale campaign performed exceptionally well with a 129% ROI, indicating it generated $2.29 for every dollar spent. The 4.73% engagement rate and 395 conversions over just 3 days demonstrate strong audience response to the flash sale format. The $61 cost per acquisition is reasonable depending on your customer lifetime value, and the campaign effectively leveraged urgency to drive immediate action."
}
